title: 'Been There, Won That': Eagles clinch NFC East
content: The Eagles clinched their second straight NFC East title by beating the Commanders 29-18 on Saturday night.

title: Eagles go for 2, igniting brawl; Sirianni backs play
content: An on-field fight resulted in three players being ejected in Saturday's Eagles-Commanders game after Philadelphia, up by 17 late in the fourth quarter, decided to go for a 2-point conversion.

title: Oregon beats JMU for first CFP win since 2014
content: No. 5 Oregon beat No. 19 James Madison 51-34 on Saturday night in a College Football Playoff opener, the Ducks' first CFP win since 2014.

title: Packers' Love concussed after hard hit vs. Bears
content: Green Bay Packers quarterback Jordan Love was ruled out of Saturday's game against the Chicago Bears because of a concussion after he took a helmet hit from defensive end Austin Booker in the second quarter.

title: For Ole Miss, a gratifying 1st CFP win without Kiffin
content: Tony Golding and Ole Miss passed their first test since Lane Kiffin's abrupt departure, blowing out Tulane on Saturday to earn the Rebels their first CFP victory.

title: Miami's defense dominates A&M for first CFP win
content: Miami's defense recorded nine tackles for loss and three takeaways, including a game-sealing interception in the end zone to cap a 10-3 Hurricanes win over Texas A&M in the College Football Playoff on Saturday.

title: üèà NFL playoff-clinching scenarios for Week 16
content: In Week 16, nine NFL teams have the chance to clinch a playoff berth. The Broncos can also lock up the AFC's No. 1 seed.

content: The Wildcats and Wolverines are battling it out for the title of best team in the country. See the full top 25.

content: Our experts dive into the lines and player props that offer value for Week 16 and share their tips and bets.

content: The 2026 Winter Olympics will be Knight's last playing for Team USA. She remains one of the faces of U.S. women's hockey.

content: A disappointing end to the men's tag team championship, was emblematic of a building-block 'SmackDown.'

title: Snow, rain in higher reaches of Kashmir as ‚ÄòChillai-Kalan‚Äô checks in
content: Snowfall was reported from the Gulmarg tourist resort in north Kashmir‚Äôs Baramulla district, where nearly two inches of snow has accumulated, officials said

title: Karnataka‚Äôs iconic toy towns: Why is the next generation walking away?
content: Channapatna and Kinnal in Karnataka are known for the unique toys. These GI-tagged toys are made by local artisans who have been doing across generations. But what does the future hold for them?

title: Maharashtra civic polls counting begins
content: Voting for the posts of president and members in 23 municipal councils and nagar panchayats across Maharashtra, as well as for 143 vacant member posts in these local bodies ended at 5:30 PM on December 20.

title: Maharashtra police helps in rescue of 7 persons from 'cyber slavery' in Myanmar's notorious KK Park
content: A probe revealed that several youths from Mira Bhayandar and Vasai-Virar were trapped in this cycle of cyber slavery

title: PM interacts with students in ‚ÄòPariksha Pe Charcha‚Äô programme in Assam
content: Security has been heightened along the entire area with the River Police, NDRF and SDRF personnel patrolling the river Brahmaputra

title: In Frames: Grounded in tradition, a Kashmiri village endures
content: Dudran is a quiet hilly village near the Line of Control, shaped by nature, tradition and resilience; despite long winters and isolation, life remains closely tied to the land, agriculture and livestock

title: U.P. ministers flay Akhilesh Yadav over photographs with cough syrup case accused
content: Minister of Fisheries Sanjay Nishad said the BJP government was following a zero-tolerance policy against illegal narcotics, organised drug mafias and unlawful medicine trade, but the opposition's conduct in the matter was deeply troubling

title: Destroy ivory stocks only after taking samples for DNA tests, Madras High Court directs T.N. forest department
content: The court also ordered that all the details regarding the ivory stocks should be tabulated and submitted before it on January 23, 2026

title: 8,500 candidates appearing on runway of airstrip for home guard job in Odisha gone viral
content: Despite the remuneration being lower than prevailing daily wages in the market, the fixed monthly payment of a little over ‚Çπ18,000 offers stability and a sense of financial assurance for families, say candidates

title: Rajasthan to strengthen arbitration proceedings in State litigation with new policy
content: An efficient teamwork between the government departments and legal fraternity would also help in the fast disposal of cases

title: Opposition expresses concern as key posts in U.P. Minorities Commission remain vacant

title: Strict action against those cheating people in the name of overseas employment, says U.P. CM Yogi
content: The U.P. CM cautioned people against falling prey to such agents, warning that illegal attempts to go abroad often lead to imprisonment

title: Madras High Court requests Salim Ali Centre for Ornithology to study revitalisation of Ukkadam and Valankulam lakes in Coimbatore
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy want to know whether the development activities had in any way affected nesting by migratory and inhabitant birds

title: Clear vote-share lead in Ernakulam district panchayat makes UDF dominance evident
content: The UDF‚Äôs vote share reflects the sweeping victory the front scored in the local body elections, winning 25 of the 28 seats, while the LDF was restricted to the remaining three

title: The quiet climb to the helm
content: The appointment of the 45-year-old Minister from Bihar as the BJP‚Äôs new national working president, close on the heels of the NDA‚Äôs big victory in the State Assembly elections, signals a generational shift within the party organisation

title: Over half of elector deletions in T.N. concentrated in eight districts in two clusters
content: Even though the Chennai and Tiruppur clusters saw the highest removals, the impact on their share of Tamil Nadu‚Äôs total elector base was relatively limited

title: Stalin inaugurates Porunai Archaeological Museum
content: The museum showcases ancient Tamil artefacts from Adichanallur, Sivakalai, Korkai, and Thulukkarpatti

title: CBI arrests Lt. Col. with Department of Defence Productions on graft charge
content: The CBI recovered the alleged bribe amount and seized ‚Çπ2.23 crore in cash from his Delhi house and ‚Çπ10 lakh from his house in Sri Ganganagar, in addition to other incriminating material, as alleged

title: Why Congress walks out of MVA in Mumbai ‚Äî and how it reshapes the civic contest
content: The move has changed the electoral combinations in a multipolar contest where all parties have high stakes.

title: Singapore tourist held for filming inside Padmanabhaswamy temple using camera-fitted glasses
content: Temple security personnel noticed the camera-equipped glasses and promptly intercepted Thiruneepanar, who was later handed over to Fort police

title: CJI to hold special vacation sitting on December 22 to hear urgent cases
content: Supreme Court is usually closed from December 19 till January 5 and no judicial work is done during this period

title: Quota for ex-Agniveers in CAPF will not impact existing matrix, says govt. official
content: Alliance of All Ex-Paramilitary Association expresses opposition to the reservation as they say it will affect the chances of other candidates

title: Claims of fake votes, fraud mar local body polls in Maharashtra
content: Special investigations and police action launched in several districts over poll chaos and electoral fraud allegations; results for all 286 municipal councils and¬†nagar¬†panchayats expected on December 21

title: Centre plans Vande Mataram-themed Republic Day fete; EU leaders invited as chief guests
content: Top EU leaders have been invited for the 77th Republic Day celebrations; EU-India Summit planned on the sidelines to finalise the much-delayed Free Trade Agreement (FTA); multiple Ministries tasked with promotion and rebranding push

title: West Bengal Government renames State‚Äôs job guarantee scheme as ‚ÄòMahatma-Shree‚Äô to honour Mahatma Gandhi
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announces the move in response to the Union Government renaming MGNREGA

title: Where Centre helps, will thank them: Omar Abdullah
content: Omar Abdullah‚Äôs recent remarks that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been liberal with funding for economically disadvantaged J&K, drew sharp reactions from leaders of the Peoples Democratic Party and the J&K Peoples Conference

title: Weighed down by grief: How Maharashtra residents are trying to fight malnutrition and lack of medical infrastructure
content: In Maharashtra‚Äôs tribal-dominated Melghat region, residents are grappling with the loss of their children due to malnutrition and delay in receiving medical care. Inadequate health infrastructure, lack of specialists, and belief in traditional healers pose challenges in reducing the high infant mortality rate, finds Snehal Mutha

title: Court grants anticipatory bail to director Kunju Muhammad in molestation case
content: Case against director following complaint that he had allegedly molested a woman at a hotel where they were staying to select Malayalam films for IFFK

title: Over 150 families left homeless after demolition drive in Yelahanka
content: Bengaluru Solid Waste Management Limited says the demolition drive is conducted to clear encroachments on government land¬†

title: Cultural resistance required to protect Constitution and democracy: Kerala CM
content: The Citizenship Amendment Act and the idea of ‚ÄòOne Nation, One Election‚Äô are attempts to destroy federalism, the Chief Minister alleges in his inaugural address at the Indian Cultural Congress 2025, organised by the Department of Culture, in Kochi

title: Law commission chief calls for Indianisation of legal system
content: At talk at Lok Bhavan, he says it is high time that the Indian justice delivery system is overhauled, making it Bharatiya

title: Andhra Pradesh notifies sweeping amendments to building rules
content: Changes aimed at enhancing urban safety, promoting green construction, and improving ease of doing business through technology-driven approvals and clearer norms for high-rise projects, says official

title: Recoveries in cybercrime cases dip as scamsters shift tactics
content: A senior officer cautioned that with the New Year approaching, cybercrimes might mushroom in the name of attractive offers

title: Bihar hijab row: Woman doctor yet to join work
content: Jharkhand Health Minister Irfan Ansari offers the doctor a government job with a monthly salary of ‚Çπ3 lakh and a posting of her choice

title: 13th Sargaalaya Arts and Crafts Festival from Dec. 23
content: Artisans from 15 countries to take part. Flower show, Tourism Expo to be held for the first time as part of the festival

title: Thrissur to host 64th Kerala School Arts Festival
content: Five-day extravaganza to be held from January 14 to 18 across 25 venues with competitions in 239 items

title: All eyes on Independent collective at Pala
content: After the oath-taking, the collective plans a ‚ÄòJanasabha‚Äô to assess community support before finalising its political stance, amid speculation of a possible alliance with the UDF.

title: Walayar mob lynching: rights activists allege bid to trivialise crime, demand ‚Çπ25 lakh compensation
content: Protest meeting in Thrissur calls the killing of Chhattisgarh native Ram Narayan a chilling reflection of growing Islamophobia in the State

title: Majority and minority communalism have to be resisted, says Kerala CM
content: He spoke at a reception organised for Samastha Shatabdi Sandesh Yatra, led by Samastha Kerala Jamiyyathul Ulama president Syed Muhammad Jifri Muthukoya Thangal, at Putharikandam Maithanam in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Solar renewable energy expo in Vijayawada turns heads
content: Event is being organised by Andhra Pradesh Solar Energy Association and displays cutting-edge innovations and sustainable solutions. It features stalls of PV modules, power inverters, energy storage (BESS), solar pumps, EV chargers, power cables, switchgear and batteries

title: Chandrababu Naidu sets Swachh targets, says Andhra Pradesh will be plastic-free by June next and roads garbage-free by January 26
content: Stressing the need for adopting a circular economy through which waste is recycled, the Chief Minister has appealed to the people to be a part of it for the benefit of the future generations

title: Kerala local body polls: LDF leads in vote share of fronts in Thiruvananthapuram district
content: The LDF received 37.27% of the votes in panchayats, compared to the UDF‚Äôs 35.30%, while the BJP-led NDA got 21.59%. In the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation, the NDA won 34.52%  of the votes and 50 seats, but the LDF captured a marginally higher vote share of 34.65%.

title: Quality of civil services decisive for Viksit Bharat, says Vice-President
content: Implementation of national priorities depends on the quality of administrators selected today, says C. P. Radhakrishnan

title: Trump signs law, wants India‚Äôs nuclear liability aligned with global norms
content: U.S. President tells Secretary of State to establish mechanism to ‚Äòassess the implementation‚Äô of 2008 nuclear deal; Congress says PM Modi ‚Äòbulldozed‚Äô SHANTI Bill to make peace with ‚Äòonce good friend‚Äô

title: RTC union seeks steps to reduce increased workload after launch of ‚ÄòStree Shakti‚Äô scheme
content: If problems are not addressed immediately, it will become difficult for the RTC bus crew to continue their duties, says APPTD president

title: Earlier, untouchability was a thing to shame people; now it is reservation: Neeraj Ghaywan
content: ‚ÄúEarlier, untouchability was a thing to shame people; now it is reservation quota. It feels like reservation is a privilege that has been accorded- It is not a poverty alleviation programme. It is a reparation for a 2,000-year-old injustice,‚Äù says Neeraj Ghaywan at The Hindu Mind

title: US visa delays: Indian H-1B workers stranded as Trump admin starts social media checks
content: US companies are grappling with significant disruptions as tighter social media checks by the Trump administration have led to prolonged visa stamping delays for Indian professionals. Many H-1B visa holders are stranded in India, forcing employers to explore remote work options or expedite travel back to the US to avoid visa expiry.

title: Airbus plans cloud shift: Company moves away from AWS, Google, Microsoft
content: Airbus is reportedly planning to migrate sensitive workloads to a European cloud, moving away from Google and Microsoft services. This move is driven by concerns over digital sovereignty and the US CLOUD Act, which allows US authorities to access data held by American companies abroad. The aerospace giant aims to ensure European control over its critical data and operations.

title: From heritage lanes to high-tech hubs: How Hyderabad Metro is changing the city
content: The Telangana government is taking over Phase-I of the Hyderabad Metro Rail from Larsen & Toubro for Rs 2,000 crore, aiming to improve public transport and bridge the city's socio-economic divide. This move is part of a larger plan to expand the Metro network, with Phase-II proposals submitted to the Centre for funding and approval.

title: 'Traumatic': Nora Fatehi after drunk driver rams into her car; recounts horrific accident
content: Bollywood actress Nora Fatehi sustained minor injuries after a drunk driver crashed into her car in Mumbai. Despite the collision, she proceeded with her scheduled performance at the Sunburn music festival. Fatehi later shared her experience on Instagram, emphasizing the dangers of drinking and driving.

title: Man opposes daughter‚Äôs relationship, 17-yr-old sedates parents, gets father killed by boyfriend
content: A 17-year-old girl allegedly orchestrated her father's murder with her lover after he persistently opposed their relationship and confined her. The girl, who had previously attempted to sedate her parents, succeeded on December 18, allowing her boyfriend and his accomplice to fatally stab her father.

title: Google‚Äôs AI boomerang: Talent war heats up; compute beats $100m paydays
content: Google is successfully luring back top AI talent with its robust computational infrastructure, including TPUs and cloud services, rather than solely relying on massive signing bonuses. This 'boomerang' strategy is proving effective, with former employees making up a significant portion of new AI hires, highlighting the value engineers place on the ability to build groundbreaking products.

title: Gunshot, knives: 3 Indian-origin men arrested in UK for violence in kabaddi match
content: Three men of Indian origin have received prison sentences for their involvement in a violent clash at a Kabbadi tournament in Alvaston. Boota Singh, Damanjit Singh, and Rajvinder Takhar Singh were convicted of violent disorder and weapon possession.

title: How BCCI‚Äôs 'Project Shubman Gill' collapsed: Inside the shocking T20 World Cup omission
content: Shubman Gill's injury opened the door for Sanju Samson, but sources reveal the team management had already planned to replace Gill at the top due to a lack of runs. This move signals a shift in strategy for the T20 World Cup, with the team management moving on from Gill as the all-format leader.

title: ‚ÄòPrepare for street movement‚Äô: Imran Khan calls for protests after 17 yrs sentence
content: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi received a 17-year prison sentence in the Toshakhana-II corruption case. Khan, through his legal team, has called for nationwide protests and plans to challenge the conviction, alleging the verdict was delivered hastily and without evidence.

title: Zuckerberg's 'highest-paid' employee is reportedly unhappy with his Boss - What he said
content: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: Nora Fatehi opens up about car crash: 'Saw my life flash before my eyes'
content: In a recent update following a serious car crash, Nora Fatehi shared that she is safe and sound despite enduring minor injuries and a concussion. The incident, triggered by a reckless drunk driver, left her rattled and thrown about in her car.

title: Watch: Mumbai BJP MLA slaps auto-rickshaw driver; Congress hits out
content: A video shows BJP MLA Parag Shah slapping a rickshaw driver in Ghatkopar East. The MLA stated the driver was violating traffic rules and residents had complained about such incidents. The incident occurred during a protest against traffic violations. Police are investigating the matter. The opposition criticized the MLA's actions.

title: Yunus says RAB, police probing Hindu man's murder in Bangladesh; 10 arrested
content: Ten individuals have been apprehended in Bangladesh following the brutal murder of Dipu Chandra Das, a Hindu garment worker. Das was allegedly beaten to death by a mob on December 18 over blasphemy accusations, with his body subsequently set ablaze. Authorities are under pressure to address mob violence amid broader unrest.

title: Anthony Joshua net worth 2025: Boxing earnings, career and Jake Paul fight payday
content: Anthony Joshua's net worth is estimated at ¬£195 million in 2025, with the majority earned from boxing purses. He also generates significant income from endorsements and property investments. Joshua is set to earn a guaranteed ¬£70 million from his upcoming fight against Jake Paul, a professionally sanctioned eight-round heavyweight bout.

title: Maple Leafs fans on edge as Auston Matthews trade talks heat up
content: Maple Leafs captain Auston Matthews is facing scrutiny as his scoring has slowed. This has sparked discussions about his future with the team. Toronto management must navigate this delicate situation. The coming months will be crucial for both Matthews and the Maple Leafs' legacy. The team aims for immediate success.

title: Vanessa Bryant net worth 2025: Wealth, legacy and life after Kobe
content: Vanessa Bryant now handles the vast financial legacy of her late husband and basketball legend, Kobe Bryant. Her net worth is estimated at $600 million as of 2025. She manages investments, endorsements, including Body Armor, and manages real estate. Vanessa also leads Granity Studios and Mamba Cita clothing and uses the money she earns from it to support young athletes. She continues brand partnerships and the Mamba & Mamba Cita Sports Foundation.

title: 'Gill‚Äôs exit was inevitable': Ashwin drops blunt truth on T20 World Cup snub
content: Shubman Gill's surprising omission from the 2026 T20 World Cup squad has ignited debate, signaling a shift in India's T20 strategy. Sanju Samson is poised to open, with Ishan Kishan returning as a second wicketkeeper. Rinku Singh secures a finisher's role, highlighting a focus on aggressive starts and defined player roles for the upcoming tournament.

title: After rising costs, America faces its next hurdle ‚Äî a ‚Äòstagnating‚Äô job market
content: US job growth is significantly slowing, with hiring at its weakest in two decades. While the economy isn't contracting, this trend, fueled by retirements and immigration restrictions, suggests a stable but uneven labor market. Experts warn of a potential K-shaped recovery, benefiting the wealthy while straining others, with AI adding further uncertainty.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Protesters break into Parliament building after Hadi‚Äôs funeral; watch
content: Tensions remain high in Dhaka after a mob breached Parliament following the funeral of youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi, who was shot dead on December 12. His killing has sparked widespread unrest, with protesters demanding justice and accusing India of harboring the suspects.

title: 'Dhurandhar' crosses Rs 500 crore in record time; eyes Rs 1,000 crore worldwide
content: Bollywood's 'Dhurandhar' continues its phenomenal box office journey, crossing Rs 500 crore net in its third week. Starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, the film is now the second-fastest to reach this milestone, surpassing 'Jawan'. With strong word-of-mouth and repeat viewership, its worldwide gross is nearing Rs 1,000 crore.

title: Delhi chokes under thick smog: AQI hits ‚Äòsevere‚Äô in some areas; flights, train services hit
content: Delhi grappled with severe smog on Sunday, triggering stringent anti-pollution measures and widespread air travel chaos. Authorities activated Stage-IV of GRAP as Air Quality Index levels soared into 'very poor' and 'severe' categories. Over 500 flights faced delays and 138 were cancelled due to drastically reduced visibility, impacting thousands of passengers.

title: Why did Lamarr Wilson commit suicide? Inside the heartbreaking loss
content: Lamarr Wilson, a well known Los Angeles based tech and lifestyle YouTuber with over 2.11 million subscribers, has died by suicide at 48. His death was confirmed by the Los Angeles County Medical Examiner and a family member. Tributes from Geoff Keighley and fans highlight Wilson‚Äôs lasting impact on the tech and creator community.

title: 'Didn‚Äôt see it coming': Former cricketer flags 'lacking clarity' after Gill, Jitesh dropped
content: The squad was announced on Saturday by BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia, captain Suryakumar Yadav and chief selector Ajit Agarkar. Axar Patel was named vice-captain. Ishan Kishan returned to the T20I side after leading Jharkhand to the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy title, while Rinku Singh was also recalled after missing the recent 3-1 series win in South Africa.

title: Watch: Video shows moment US forces 'apprehend' oil tanker
content: The US Coast Guard, with Department of Defense backing, seized an oil tanker off Venezuela, citing its connection to sanctioned oil funding narco-terrorism. This follows a previous seizure and President Trump's threats of a blockade.

title: Mumtaz took Rs 18‚Äì20 lakh to appear with Dharmendra, rejected Seeta Aur Geeta due to low fee
content: Veteran actor Mumtaz, who made her first television appearance in over five decades alongside Dharmendra on Indian Idol Season 13 in 2023, has revealed that she consciously avoids TV shows because she feels they don‚Äôt pay her what she deserves.

title: US immigration crackdown: Google and Apple warn visa workers; firms say 'don't travel.'
content: Google and Apple have advised US-based employees on work visas against international travel due to potential 12-month delays at US embassies. This follows warnings from outside counsel about significant visa stamping appointment backlogs. The delays are attributed to new social media screening requirements for visa applicants.

title: 'Bangladesh won't forget your mantra': Yunus vows to fulfill Osman Hadi's dream
content: Bangladesh's chief adviser Muhammad Yunus vowed to fulfill the dream of slain youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi, whose death has sparked widespread protests and calls for justice. Hadi's sacrifice is being honored with a commitment to national progress and rejecting hatred ahead of upcoming elections and a referendum.

title: 8.5¬∞C in Bengaluru Urban dist? Cold wave and fog tighten their grip in festive season; holiday travel disrupted
content: Karnataka is experiencing a significant cold spell as winter tightens its grip, with dense morning fog disrupting travel. Minimum temperatures have dipped 2-3¬∞C below normal across the state, with north-interior districts like Bidar recording the lowest at 5.3¬∞C. The chill is expected to persist through the month-end.

title: Delhi airport assault: Govt orders probe; passenger says forced to write letter
content: An Air India Express pilot allegedly assaulted a passenger at Delhi airport's Terminal 1 after a verbal altercation over queue jumping. The Ministry of Civil Aviation has ordered a probe and grounded the pilot, while the passenger claims he was pressured to not file a police complaint.

title: IndiGo alerts: Dense fog may disrupt flights across North India; travel advisory issued
content: IndiGo has issued a travel advisory warning of potential flight disruptions due to early-morning fog in Delhi and northern India on Sunday. Reduced visibility may cause delays or schedule changes, with operations teams monitoring weather to minimize inconvenience. Passengers are advised to check flight status and rebook or seek refunds if affected.

title: Grey skies, high AQI: Delhi air worsens; smoggy struggle ahead
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'severe' category with AQI reaching 407, driven by unfavorable weather conditions like temperature inversion, high humidity, and calm winds. Authorities are cracking down on illegal construction and industrial activities, with no respite expected until December 22nd.

title: CAG: Railways lags in non-fare earnings, recovery of dues
content: Railways is losing out on significant non-fare revenue, with vast vacant land undeveloped and Rs 4,087 crore in dues from private siding owners unrecovered. Audits reveal weak monitoring and enforcement, with RLDA awarding only a fraction of entrusted land for development. Systemic issues and poor inter-agency coordination are hindering timely monetization and revenue realization.

title: Congress nearly joined conspiracy to make Assam part of East Pakistan: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi launched a sharp attack on Congress in Guwahati, accusing the party of a pre-Independence conspiracy with the Muslim League and British to annex Assam into East Pakistan. He alleged Congress later altered Assam's demography for electoral gains, leading to encroachment on land and forests, jeopardizing the state's security and identity. Modi urged vigilance against such 'anti-national' agendas.

title: 50% quota for ex-Agniveers in constable-level BSF jobs
content: The Home Ministry has reserved 50% of constable vacancies in the Border Security Force for ex-Agniveers, a five-fold increase from the initial 10%. This move aims to incentivize youth joining the armed forces by offering them a follow-up career in central paramilitary forces. Ex-Agniveers will also be exempted from physical tests.

title: With 'Rishi Bankim babu', PM Modi defuses 'Bankim da' row in West Bengal
content: PM Modi addressed a virtual rally in Bengal due to fog, focusing on reassuring Matua voters and countering criticism over his "Bankim da" remark. He praised cultural icons and linked the Citizenship Amendment Act to curbing infiltration, while also highlighting development projects and contrasting Bengal's governance with Bihar's.

title: T20 WC squad: 'Very happy' Ishan Kishan reacts to India recall as Gill misses out
content: Ishan Kishan expressed his delight after being selected for India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad, returning to the national side following a stellar Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy campaign. Suryakumar Yadav will lead the 15-member team, with Shubman Gill notably excluded due to form and fitness concerns.

title: 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' crosses Rs 50 crore mark; 'Dhurandhar' stays dominant
content: James Cameron's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' has crossed Rs 50 crore in India within two days, showing strong family entertainer appeal. Despite a modest 15% growth on Saturday, its Rs 22.35 crore Day 2 collection lags significantly behind its predecessor.  The film's performance is being impacted by the continued success of 'Dhurandhar'.

title: Travis Kelce explains postgame silence after Chiefs‚Äô loss, cites Mahomes
content: Travis Kelce‚Äôs unexpected postgame silence after the Kansas City Chiefs‚Äô loss to the Los Angeles Chargers sparked NFL speculation, but the tight end later explained it came from concern for Patrick Mahomes rather than frustration or retirement talk. Prioritizing privacy over headlines, Kelce focused on supporting his quarterback, leaving the situation and his future closely watched across the league.

title: No ‚Äòsanskar‚Äô, UP police arrest 4 women after sons ‚Äòharass‚Äô teen girl
content: In Budaun, police arrested four mothers under preventive laws after their sons, all under 13, allegedly harassed a Class 8 girl. The action aims to hold parents accountable for not instilling 'good values'. Fathers, working out of state, will face arrest upon return. Legal experts question the use of preventive detention against parents.

title: Assam: Rajdhani mows down 7 jumbos in Hojai; 4 of them calves
content: A tragic collision between the Rajdhani Express and a herd of wild elephants in Assam's Hojai district resulted in the deaths of seven elephants, including four calves. The accident also derailed the train's locomotive and five coaches. While no passengers were injured, the incident has sparked calls for improved wildlife corridor safety and investigation into the cause.

title: Donald Trump To Bill Clinton, Full List Of People Named In Epstein Files
content: The "Epstein files" were made public after sustained pressure on the US Department of Justice and a congressional order demanding transparency.

title: 10 Killed In Mass Shooting In South Africa
content: Unknown gunmen killed 10 people and wounded 10 others in an attack at a township outside Johannesburg, police said Sunday, in the second mass shooting in South Africa this month.

title: Hindu Lynched In Bangladesh, Investigators Find No Proof Of His 'Blasphemy'
content: There is no direct evidence that Dipu Chandra Das, the Hindu man lynched in Bangladesh's Mymensingh for alleged blasphemy, actually made any remark hurting anyone's religious sentiment, investigation into the chilling murder has found.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla To NDTV On Actor Who Should Play Him In His Biopic
content: Shubhanshu Shukla, India's first astronaut to travel to the International Space Station, was honoured as the Science Icon of the Year' at the NDTV Indian of the Year 2025 awards.

title: "Generation After Generation...": Yunus's Vow At Anti-India Leader's Funeral
content: Sharif Osman Hadi, a polarising figure known for his strong anti-India rhetoric, gained prominence during Bangladesh's 2024 student uprising that led to the ouster of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina last year.

title: Madhya Pradesh Man, 90, Killed As Truck With Gravel Overturns On Him
content: Residents said he was sitting outside his home, enjoying the winter sunlight, when a dump truck arrived in the area for construction work at a nearby house.

title: 7-Year-Old Girl Burnt To Death As Bangladesh Leader's House Set On Fire
content: Amid escalating violence in Bangladesh, a child was killed and three others critically injured on Saturday after the house of a BNP leader was allegedly locked from the outside and set on fire in Lakshmipur Sadar upazila.

title: Epstein Files Go Public, But Survivors' Interviews Missing
content: The Justice Department's much-anticipated release of records tied to Jeffrey Epstein arrived in a flood of documents that did little to quell the long-simmering intrigue, largely because some of the most consequential records were nowhere to be found

title: "Is This The Best Government Can Do?" Victims Slam Epstein Files' Release
content: Victims of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein on Saturday expressed anger after a long-awaited cache of records from cases against him were released with many pages blacked-out and photos censored.

title: Dense Fog In Delhi, Air Quality Edges Close To 'Severe' Category
content: Air pollution levels in the national capital deteriorated sharply on Sunday, edging dangerously close to the "severe" category as dense smog, plunging temperatures, and thick fog blanketed large swathes of northern India.

title: "Never Shared Pain With Us": Family Of Man Who Immolated Self Amid Deepam Row
content: The man died by self-immolation amid an ongoing legal and political dispute over whether the 'deepam' could be lit on a pillar atop the Thiruparankundram hill.

title: Is One S Jaishankar Enough For India? Then His "There Is One Modi" Reply
content: Emphasising India's own traditions and highlighting instances of strategy and statecraft in its scriptures, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday said that Lord Krishna and Lord Hanuman were "greatest diplomats."

title: "Very Scary, Traumatic": Nora Fatehi's Car Hit By Drunk Driver In Mumbai
content: Actor and dancer Nora Fatehi met with a car accident in Mumbai after a drunk driver rammed into the vehicle she was travelling in, an incident she later described as "very scary" and "traumatic."

title: "Grainy 20-Plus-Year-Old Photos": Bill Clinton's Aide On New Epstein Files
content: A photo showed Bill Clinton in a pool with Jeffrey Epstein's longtime confidant, British socialite Ghislaine Maxwell, and a person whose face was redacted.

title: Woman Engineer Becomes 1st Wheelchair User To Fly To Space On Blue Origin
content: A German woman engineer on Saturday became the first wheelchair user to blast into space, taking a brief ride on a Blue Origin flight.

title: Google, Apple Warn US Staff With H-1B Visas Against International Travel: Report
content: The Trump administration has announced increased vetting of applicants for H-1B visas for highly skilled workers, including screening social media accounts.

title: 10 Arrested Over Lynching Of Hindu Man In Bangladesh
content: Ten individuals have been arrested in connection with the brutal murder of Dipu Chandra Das, a 25-year-old Hindu youth, in Mymensingh, Bangladesh. The Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) apprehended seven suspects, while the police arrested three others.

title: Trump's Photo Among 16 Epstein Files Disappeared From US Government Website
content: At least 16 files disappeared from the Justice Department's public webpage for documents related to Jeffrey Epstein - including a photograph showing President Donald Trump - less than a day after they were posted

title: Navi Mumbai Airport's Dress Rehearsal Before First Flight On December 25
content: With five days to go before the first flight takes off from Navi Mumbai International Airport, the NMIA is preparing start operations on December 25, a globally recognised readiness programme.

title: 4th elephant death on rail tracks this year, toll rises to 94 since 2019

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who intends to transfer
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Texas Tech jolts unbeaten Duke with 17-point rally
content: Texas Tech beat third-ranked Duke 82-81 at Madison Square Garden . Christian Anderson scored 23 of his 27 points in the second half . Isaiah Evans grabbed the rebound with 1.6 seconds remaining . it was the program's first win all-time in 3 games against top 25 opponents .

title: Sources: Rams fire ST coordinator after TNF loss
content: new: the move marks the first in-season coaching change that the Rams have made in his nine seasons in Los Angeles . new: a source tells ESPN's Adam Schefter . the team's assistant special teams coach Ben Kotwica will take over and become the lead coach .

title: College Football Playoff 2025: Quarterfinal first look
content: the canes beat Texas A&M thanks to an interception in the end zone in the final seconds of the game, and they will play Ohio State in the Cotton Bowl . the cotton bowls will be played on Jan. 1 and will be held on Dec. 31 .

title: The Jake Paul show is far from over, but where does it go from here?
content: Anthony Joshua beats Jake Paul in the sixth round of the heavyweight fight . the fight between Joshua and Joshua was announced on friday . he was outclassed, dropped four times and knocked out by Joshua . his critics say he will continue his boxing career .

title: Arsenal are 'Christmas champions,' but that'll count for nothing if Gunners can't hold
content: arsenal beat Everton 2-1 in their premier league clash on saturday . the win was a slog rather than a win built on attacking football . a first-half penalty was enough to earn the three points .

title: Questions, takeaways from NFL Week 16: Resilient Bears pull out OT thriller; Eagles repeat as NFC East champs
content: Chicago erases a 10-point fourth-quarter deficit to beat the Packers in overtime and jump into first place in the NFC North . the game was one of the best games of the season as the Bears overcame another late deficit to pull out an OT win over the Packers .

title: 'OK, now tap your smiley face': How Kentucky's Eva Hudson is finding joy in the game
content: it's match point in the fifth set of the NCAA women's college volleyball semifinals between no.1 seed Kentucky and no. 3 seed Wisconsin . the Badgers blocked the shot out of bounds, but Hudson's power was too much for even the best defenders .

title: Our guide to every game: Matchup previews, predictions and what's at stake
content: Rich Eisen picks the Broncos over the Jaguars to win more playoff games . the 49ers play the Colts on "Monday Night Football" on ESPN . we have a key stat to know and a betting nugget for each contest .
